Qualities Needed in Understanding Minds (counsel to a literature evangelist).--There are more difficulties in this work that in some other branches of business; but the 


                                                      81 

lessons learned, the tact and discipline acquired, will fit you for other fields of usefulness, where you can minister to souls. Those who poorly learn their lesson and are careless and abrupt in approaching persons would show the same want [lack] of tact and skill in dealing with minds should they enter the ministry.--Manual for Canvassers, pp. 41, 42, 1902. (CM 34.)
